alert.note: Alert for San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 4:14PM CDT until April 20 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central and Eastern San Saba County in west central Texas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 412 PM CDT, Radar indicated thunderstorms with very heavy rain repeatedly developing over central and eastern San Saba County. Rainfall of 2 to 3 inches has already fallen, and an additional amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are expected in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Saba, Algerita, Sloan, Chappel, Bend, Harkeyville and Us-190 Near The San Saba-Lampasas County Line. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1030 crossing Wallace Creek, CR 340 crossing San Saba River, CR 340 crossing Dry Creek, CR 424 crossing Rough Creek, CR 208 crossing San Saba River and County Road 432 crossing Cherokee Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
